title: Provider duty: appoint an authorised representative in the Union (third-country providers)

article_refs.quote: Prior to making their high-risk AI systems available on the Union market, providers established in third countries shall, by written mandate, appoint an authorised representative which is established in the Union.

legal_consequence.verbatim: Prior to making their high-risk AI systems available on the Union market, providers established in third countries shall, by written mandate, appoint an authorised representative which is established in the Union.

items.label: Penalty (Art. 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement; administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% turnover may apply.

question.prompt: Is the provider established in a third country (outside the Union)?
